info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 5:02AM EDT until April 7 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River near Centerton down to Hazleton.
Eel River at Bowling Green.
.Widespread ongoing minor flooding along Eel River and the White River from Morgan County down to Knox County...will rise into Moderate Flood levels this morning at most points. Major flood levels are expected to follow in Knox County starting Sunday night. Flooding will crest on points in Clay and Morgan County tonight... and downstream points next week. Major Flooding may last for several days along Knox County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Eel River at Bowling Green.
* WHEN...Until Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flood water, possibly a foot deep, covers SR 42 just east of the Eel River. Several county roads flood extensively. Persons in river cabins move cars and possibly belongings to high ground. Agricultural levees are threatened. Poland-Bowling Green Road is impassable in several places.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 AM EDT Saturday was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 815 PM EDT /715 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING
